alert.note: Alert for Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Warren County through 545 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Goodland to near Potomac. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Warren County, including the following locations... West Lebanon, Rainsville, Pine Village, Tab, Pence and State Line City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for west central Indiana.
